intro: Notanthera ovatus, commonly known as the broad-leafed notanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikes, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Notanthera ovatus is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream banks.
